titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Long Island Insurance Company subscription book and architectural drawing 1977.013
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-09-20 19:07:06 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Long Island Insurance Company subscription book and architectural drawing
did.abstract: This collection contains a subscription book to the capital stock of the Long Island Insurance Company, dated 1833, and an architectural drawing of the Company's building by Richard Laurence, dated 1834.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Walter Nichols, date unknown.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The Long Island Insurance Company was organized in Brooklyn in 1833.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Long Island Insurance Company subscription book and architectural drawing, 1977.013, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains a subscription book to the capital stock of the Long Island Insurance Company, dated 1833, and an architectural drawing of the Company's building by Richard Laurence, dated 1834.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection are in the public domain.

While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
